website_summaries.verdict: Good collection of features in a reasonably priced nailer, but doesn't have the longevity of other models.
pros: Accepts nails ranging in size from 2 to 3.5 inches in length
Can adjust direction of air exhaust
Good power tool for those who need basic features for at-home use or who don't have much experience with nailers
cons: Model may begin to leak air near the trigger over time, causing the nailer to stop working properly

customer_reviews.title: Around the same price as renting you can own
customer_reviews.text: They say you get what you pay for but with this thing you get a little more. It is very reasonably priced. Solid. It does stop shooting once you get to the last 3 nails. But this is to protect the framer since it is really knocking the nails out. It is big and heavy. Comes with a single shot trigger which makes me thing it is geared more to the novice but it does include a red trigger for holding down and nailing.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Worked well while it worked.. broke after less than 1 box of nails, not covered under warranty.
customer_reviews.text: The trigger assembly is leaking air and will not fire the gun any more. I have ran less than 1000 nails through this unit at about 100 lbs of pressure. Apparently I can order parts and repair the unit myself according to customer service. its 30 dollars.... The misleading 1 year warranty is actually only for the casing of the gun... All other parts are only covered for 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is what you call "money well spent". I've been framing my basement with this nailer for the last three weeks by myself and I haven't had any issue at all. Very good tool.
customer_reviews.author: cut111

customer_reviews.title: Excellent framing nailer, highly reliable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to install a backyard fence and then later finish my basement. I had zero issues with this nailer and it worked every time. I paired it with a Portal Cable compressor that I also purchased on Amazon and everything worked great. It makes the job soooooo much easier. Highly recommend. Only negative was the box came damaged, but thats because Amazon put the 30 lb box of nails in the same box. So maybe do not select "group my items" if ordering together.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Blown away!! Awesome nail gun. Hangs with the best of them.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this nailer based on the amazon reviews. Honesty wasn't expecting much for the price, really just wanted to finish the job i started and not spend a fortune on a new nailer. The nailer feels great in your hand, not heavy but still quality built. I started running the nailer and i was blown away. Perfect output everytime! I've run about 2500-3000 nails through it now and honestly not one jam. I'm using Metabo branded nails (avail. @ Lowes) I've loaded single nails, doubles and triples in it and it fires everything without jamming. My bostitich would hang up on anything less than 4 nail bundles. Great job NuMax!! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mokey

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Even at maximum setting, the adjustment knob won't allow the 3-1/2" nail to be driven flush. The knob just runs out of threads. if you depress the pressure plate, you can see that there's at least 1/4" of adjustment--but you can't do it. I tried settings from 80 to 100 psi, no difference. Too bad, the unit looks very much like my old Porter-Cable which consistently drove 3-1/2' nails @ 80psi. I thought I'd take a chance and buy this nailer, I figured repairing the P-C would cost about the same. btw: when I unboxed this nailer, I thought is was a twin of my old P-C. Guess not.
customer_reviews.author: R. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: A little annoying that it stops shooting when you're down to three ...
customer_reviews.text: Have run about 4000 nails through it so far. Built a shed, framed some walls in my house. Solid performer for the money. No jams. No misfires. A little annoying that it stops shooting when you're down to three nails, but as soon as you drop in the next clip, you're shooting again.
customer_reviews.author: KurtAKX

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Lowes and Home Depot you are ripping us off!
customer_reviews.text: I am framing a three season porch and I looked at 3 1/2 nailers in Lowes, the cheapest of which was getting on for $200. I was thinking f....... it for that amount of money I'll just hammer the nails in. When I saw this nailer on Amazon I thought it must be a scam for this price. NO it is not. Works perfectly and after driving 2000 nails it's still going strong
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: It is piece of junk. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly I admit I'm new to air framing nailer. I'm building a shed in my backyard. I bought this one because it is cheaper than others. I don't need nailer after this project. It turns out it is a mistake. 1. It always leave 3, 4 nails in the magazine each round. 2. It misfire all the time. 3. After about 150 nails, it jammed. The strange thing is the nail head is pointing down instead of the tip. I can't take it out. I give up on this nailer. I want to return it. When I was trying to return back to amazon, I was told it is not qualified to return. What the heck!
customer_reviews.author: FAN

customer_reviews.title: Does not include a protective storage case.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet but have a project that will give it a workout next week. I wanted to start this review by just nothing this tool does not come with a storage case. In fact the manufacturer's box didn't have any protective padding for shipping. Just the nailer in a box. So this is either a good sign or a bad one. Either the nailer is so tough it doesn't need protection or, the manufacturer's attention to detail is poor. Time and lots of nails will tell. I'm sure not having a tool case is my error. I became complacent as all my power tools for last 20 years have come with great protective storage cases.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Inventor

customer_reviews.title: Really great nail gun for the price
customer_reviews.text: We were building a small barn and I thought this nail gun would make the job easier. My husband had never used a nail gun and really didn't think we needed it. He has since thanked me dozens of times!! We have not had any issues with this nailer.. no jams, etc. and we've gone thru over a thousand nails so far. It is a little heavy, but probably not more than any other brand. Unless you're a professional, I think this nailer is perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Minix

customer_reviews.title: NuMax Nail Gun Worked Flawlessly Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: The NuMax nail gun worked flawlessly out of the box. Read the operation manual, put on my safety glasses and hearing protection, connected my Husky compressor, added 2 inch nails, adjusted output pressure to 90psi, and wallah! 62 feet of fencing with pickets is nailed solid. No misfires. I suggest practicing on some spare 2x4's or similar project wood to get the hang of the nail gun kick-back and depth adjustment on the nail gun. Very pleased with this product. Side note: This is the first time I had ever used a nail gun. It was easy to operate. It does get heavy after nailing 500 plus nails, but a great deal to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyCB

customer_reviews.title: Great price, quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was our first nail gun and it has worked great. We are renovating a house so it has gotten a ton of use. We have mostly used it to build walls. It has saved a lot of pain putting nails in by hand. For a first time user it is great. It is easy to handle and move around your project. The nails are easy to put in as well, never had any issues with a nail getting stuck. It is great quality for the price and I have no complaints about it. It has made our live so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat this for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I had a framing gun similar to this before I relocated 800 miles away. I have no clue why I gave it away except that I *hoped* I would never have to do work again which required such a tool. I was wrong. When a contractor who was supposed to repair my fence took 1/3 of my money and never came back, I decided to start myself. I love this gun. It is much lighter than my old one (but not really 'light') and VERY easy to maneuver. We will be replacing our fence all around in sections, and I know this gun will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Nola Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great gun!
customer_reviews.text: Ive worked as a framer professionally and know how most guns feel. This is definitely not one used on job sites but I didn’t purchase for that purpose. This gun is excellent for a DIY project. A bit on the heavy side but made well and expect it to hold up for many years. I have a small project that I need to get done and will update afterward. The item I purchased was renewed for $61. You can’t beat that price. Anything over $125, I would recommend finding a lighter gun but this cheap, you can’t expect top quality. I’m very pleased with this purchase after a few test fires.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Better keep a hammer and nail puller nearby
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me build a shed. Saw it had good reviews for its pricing. It ended up being way more trouble than help. I would have to either finish hitting the nail in (after multiple test nails on scrap wood), or it would shoot nails out at an angle, or jam. I had to use a nail puller or a hammer after almost every nail. I ended up just using screws. Waste of money. Buy a more quality one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: Decent Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: A good tool. Drove nails effectively. Found that despite oiling as per instructions, every so many nails I'd have to manually pull down the collar at the nailing head to "reset" the unit. Otherwise, it wouldn't fire. Not a huge deal, but a little irritating when you're flying through production nailing (e.g. sheathing install). Drove nails into 3/4 OSB under-layment and into 2x6 joist without any problem. The unit is fairly light for the size. Other than the collar sticking, I'd give this a positive "thumbs up."
customer_reviews.author: TJS

customer_reviews.title: 125PSI 3 Gallon weekend user?  Stop searching, this is the nail gun you want...
customer_reviews.text: PRO: 1. OH MY FREAKING GAWD! This thing is AWESOME! 2. First nail gun of my own and I love it. 3. Powerful, drives a nail through TWO 2x4 boards no problem 4. Adjustable, takes a few different angels of nails, most common size. CON: 1. NONE ! 2. I SAID THERE WERE NONE! OTHER: 1. BUY if you want an awesome, inexpensive nail gun, that works well and even works on a small 125PSI 3 gallong compressor. 2. DON'T BUY if you're going to use for work, daily use, etc. this is perfect for a projects shed builder kind of guy.
customer_reviews.author: Blaydese

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nailer to build a deck and man it’s been helpful. I’ve shot about a thousand 3” and 3.5” nails and no jams. It just barely fits between 16” OC framing. I’ve oiled it before every use. I have been using a 8 gallon 1.5hp 4.1cfm HF compressor and found with the tool pressure set to 100psi on a 50’ hose it drives the nails consistently and I only occasionally need to pause for the pump to catch up. Very happy with this purchase, money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: John Hall

customer_reviews.title: Must have for occasional carpenter.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was doing a large remodeling project, but I did not want to drop 3-4 hundred on a professional air nailer. This nailer worked flawlessly for the entire project and really was one of the best tools I have ever bought. I would never have been able to finish my project without an air nailer and this one was perfect. I ran about 1,000 nails through it on that project and it is still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: Really speeds things up
customer_reviews.text: i have had a finish nail gun for years. this is my first framing nailer. it works great. no mis fires and i love the feature where it doesnt fire if you only have six nails left. when that happens i just reload and the nail gun doesnt suffer any damage from dry fire. i dont know how good this would hold up to a professional but as for me and my usage its perfect. i have already gone through 500 nails and have bought another box of a thousand. its made my porch remodel a much easier job.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Memories

customer_reviews.title: WD-40 The Trigger for A+++ performance 👍
customer_reviews.text: WD-40 the trigger right out of the box!! Weekend worrior here. Framing my basement...this thing throws nails wonderfully 👍. I've done construction before, and used name brand framers...for me, I really can't tell the difference. And since I didn't need it to last for 30 houses, just my basement...it's good enough for who it's for. I found that the trigger assembly was kinda' seizing up, not allowing for it to depress. At first, it looked like the lower part if the safety mechanism was the problem...don't adjust anything...just squirt some WD-40 into the trigger, and it's as smooth as butta'
customer_reviews.author: Jonas Nazaruk

customer_reviews.title: light and powerful framing nail gun
customer_reviews.text: used this to redo the roof of my house. due to rats infesting the attic space of my roof, i had to tear it all up and replace all the insulation as well. during this time changes were made to the roof frame structure. this nail gun did it's job very well and lightweight magnesium housing made it much easier for my retired father to handle while he was up there with me. took as 2 months to redo the roof so the framing nail gun was used everyday, no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: David Le

customer_reviews.title: I Really Like This Nail Gun
customer_reviews.text: This is my first nail gun and I had never used one before. Bought nails for it at Harbor Freight and built two partition walls with it on my first afternoon. Only had one issue where gun shot two nails together, but that was probably operator error. Haven't had any other issues since that first day and have used the nail gun extensively since then. It is a little heavy when driving nails above shoulder height and takes some practice, but I really like this nail gun.
customer_reviews.author: Lance E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Home Gamer tool. Gets it done on the cheaps.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good nailer for a project. I used it to build a fence. This is by no means a perfect product but it did get the job done. I own several numax nailers and this is my least favorite. It’s heavy, misfires, double fires and is pretty unwieldy for all day use. Having said that it made quick work of my fence project. If I was going to use everyday I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Yasatovich

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It worked just fine for my project and for the price it's hard to beat. Probably not for the professional but for occasional use, I think its fine. As one reviewer mentioned it does stop shooting when your down to your last 3 or 4 nails and that's true, just put in more and your off. I wouldn't call it light weight but it seems to be about the same as others I've used in the past. Still a lot better than swinging a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Clay

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and novice-friendly
customer_reviews.text: Overall quite happy with the nailer. Does its job and the option of a swappable manual fire and bump fire trigger is nice to train people on. Didn't quite make 5 star because it likes to double-fire in either fire modes. Haven't used one that was this twitchy and looking through other reviews this is a somewhat common issue. Additionally the anti-dry-fire feature may not kick in at 5 nails, I have had it drop to two before it stops firing. Has done well for getting a shed framed and paneled, saved a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: R0AHN

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to doing production work because I used to build/ repair houses for a living, but when my gun finally gave out me and i needed something for my last project i was finishing this came in cheap and it came fast. After using it for a while i got the hang of it and could finish my job. For the price i don't think i could beat it. This is not an every day type of gun but it is one for smaller projects. I finished remodeling a church and rebuilding a new roof with this gun.
customer_reviews.author: James & Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these nailers and am very disappointed. I used this probably no more than a few hours and the nailer fell probably 4 feet and hit a concrete floor and this damaged the plastic housing on the top of the nailer and air now leaks from it so much that is basically unusable. I would not recommend. I wish I would have spent my money on a name brand nailer that has metal housing. This was a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: What a Wonderful Life!

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to build a carport. The gun worked and never did jam. We probably used at least 500 nails. It gun is heavy but that is to be expected. I was kind of scared of it in the beginning but the safety features on it are great. A nail is not going to come out unless the head is depressed and pushed against the wood when you pull the trigger. We plan on building a workshop in the spring and will be using it for that project also. Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to get a nail gun, but just never pulled the trigger, so to speak. Didn't want to spend a ton of money for my first one, so went with this NuMax. I found it simple to use, very reliable, and very consistent. I'd highly recommend it if you're pretty much just a weekend warrior like me and want a good solid tool at a reasonable price. Don't see any reason I'll need to upgrade anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a compliment to my 21* full head. This 34* clipped head nailer can hold twice as many nails as my 21*. Some geographical areas such as the south US requires full head nails, however I can use clipped head in the mid-west. There are times I want the full head for the hold power, but many times it is not required for me. I have put over 1,500 nails though it without any jams or double shots.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 I've spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to frame a shed. I usually buy high-end tools, but I don't think I'll be using this again so I took a chance on the low end. The shed is framed and sided, and I only had one jam! Took about 15 seconds to fix. I would not have wanted to all that with a hammer. I can't vouch for how this would do day in and day out, but for a DIY project it was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY types, would not be suitable for a professional
customer_reviews.text: Impressive for the price. Built a fence with it, and will use it to frame interior walls next. No major problems, but some minor ones. If I were a pro, this gun is just not reliable enough. It occasionally jams. If the nails are not put into the hopper perfectly, with the heads overlapping each other in a specific way, it will jam or not work. Sometimes it double taps a nail and jams. When building the fence I borrowed a neighbors Hitachi gun and it has none of these problems, but it is much more expensive. Even so, none of these problems detract from the fact that this is the best DIY nailer out there.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: I used this nailer to build a shed and I used about 1500 nails through it with no problems. I bought the 21 degree nails at harbor freight for cheap and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: B Chap

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I used this framer to build a cabin. We used it with 4 different nail types/lengths. To date, I've run about 7,000 nails through it. I had maybe a half dozen jams that required pulling all the nails and using pliers to coax out the stuck one. Not sure if that was a factor of the nails or the gun but not a bad number for the volume. Only other issue i had was mis-fires seemed to come in bunches where the pin would go but no nail. Was a combination of needing to adjust the air hose and possibly the nails being stuck. Not a huge issue. This was a big help and I can't imagine hand nailing again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, good value
customer_reviews.text: I can only compare this to the similar Porter Cable framing nailer I owned before for doing remodeling on my home. This nail gun is larger and heavier, but the build quality compares well to the Porter Cable. The project I'm working on doesn't require maneuverability, so I can't comment on that aspect. I do find that the gun sets nails reliably and with good consistency.
customer_reviews.author: W. Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Great starter nailer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had it a few days, and it’s already proven itself worthy of a great review. Considering the price, this is a crazy good deal. It’s nothing fancy, but it’s sturdy and works fine. Perfect for if you don’t want to break your wrist hammering giant nails into framing, and cheap enough that if it breaks, I’ll be ready for a pricier nailer later and will be ready to take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Overall a fair framing nail gun
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty good, but it jams alot. And it gets annoying sometimes when you cannot remove the nail and have to take it apart or take another nail to pry out the stuck nail. Usually the magic number is 4 or 5 nails left in the gun it gets jammed up. I'm not sure if it's my pick of the bunch that is bad or all of the nail guns are bad, but it is really annoying. Imagine 4 to 5 out of every set is bad... it wastes your money in nails. But gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: JPC1080

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The product is great especially for the price. If you’re an average DIYer this is less than half the cost of the big-brand names and works just as well in my experience after renting a more expensive unit. The only downside to this is it is a bit heavier than the more expensive units. As for longevity, I have other nailers from this brand that are 5 yrs old and are doing fine
customer_reviews.author: N. Ikwa

customer_reviews.title: Junk, don't bother with it, spend the money quality item
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get 100 nails through this jalopy, returns were super easy. I wanted to like it was going to use it for a project and re-sell it, didn't get it that far. Not the easiest to adjust, jammed if there were 3 or 1 mags of nails in the gun, heavy and it's a cheap framing nail gun. Bought a name brand that was lighter, easier to adjust, and worked with no jams with about 900 nails at the stray cats in the neighborhood., er the sheathing and siding
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great framing nailer
customer_reviews.text: It was my first time using a framing nailer. All I can say is life changing!! I should’ve bought one of these 25 years ago. I was very happy with this purchase. I put Up a wooden fence with it in no time and now have a several more projects lined up. This product exceeded my expectations, it was packaged well and arrived on time. Nails were easy to acquire thru Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a misfire yet. Been using it to build a shed with 3 1/2in and 2 1/2in nails. I have been through both boxs of 500 nails and started my next box of 3in nails. I can't really toe nail with it very well. I also pulled the rubber anti-mar end piece off because you can gauge where the nail goes better without it. It comes right off.
customer_reviews.author: ranman

customer_reviews.title: Shoots 3” nails flush with an underpowered compressor
customer_reviews.text: I was really sweating the compressor side of this purchase, thinking that my tiny 3 gallon HF pancake compressor would just jam this gun...nope! No jams and the 3” galvanized ring shank nails blasted flush into a redwood 4x4. I’m going to upgrade my compressor to a 6 gallon Bostitch pancake for less cycling, but I’m absolutely impressed with the nailer thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and proclaimed reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I like the price very much, especially since it drives big nails very well. It's easy to load and as far as I can tell it's built okay. No jams at all but I expect those periods are ahead but I definitely cannot compete with a hammer, not even close. With those simple anecdotes don't place any undue weight on my review: it's my first and I bought it based on the reviews from real carpenters and,,,the cheap price. Look at the bostitch for life review, or the Makita, paslode, hitachi owner reviews-the guys that go through nails like a crack smoking machine gunner blows through bullets.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Honse

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Helping me replace some siding and will help me build a foundation for my new shed. For the price, this cannot be beat - especially for a diy'er. I had a question about it, and the customer service responded quickly to my email with pictures in the answer! I like that I can adjust the depth. I jammed it once, and it was easy to clear. The adjustable exhaust has come in handier than I expected. I thought I'd want a swivel fitting, but I haven't missed it at all. I haven't tried the other trigger to be able to bump nail. I'm not really sure I will for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: Trigger valve failed after first use
customer_reviews.text: Built a small fence, maybe 800 nails. Properly oiled as directed. Put in the closet for 6 months, pulled out for next project and it is leaking air from the trigger. This seems to be a common problem with these guns. I'm done buying cheap crap. If I can't afford a quality tool, I will rent one.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Flawless performer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun for my boss (owns a small construction & remodeling business) as his big brand name gun failed. We’ve been running it for 3 months on roof sheathing, wall framing and subfloor and it has performed flawlessly. I’ve worked with a lot of nail guns, this one is a little heavier than some but it’s a great value. Don’t spend the extra money for a big name brand, this baby is a gem.
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh_Sharps

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, Inexpensive, Heavier than Hitachi or Senco
customer_reviews.text: We needed an inexpensive nailer to use on framing out our basement. This one fit the bill... it has been reliable, and readily accepts standard nail gun nails with full heads. The only gripe is that it is heavier than a Hitachi, or other brand name nailer...but, for short term or occasional users it's a small price to pay for a under $100 nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Old Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was hesitant to buy this tool due to the very low price. Have owned it for about 3 months now and it has been performing perfectly. I am shooting 3" stainless deck nails in a harsh coastal environment and it has not misfired once. Probably put 3,000 to 4,000 nails thru the tool so far. Only slight issue is that the tool seems to "bounce a bit" when the trigger is pulled and the nails don't set all the way. I just push down on the top of the tool when firing and the nails set properly. There might be an adjustment for this, I am just too busy building to take the time to investigate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this framing nail gun due to the reviews. This was a big mistake I didn’t even get 2000 nails through this gun when the trigger mechanism completely fell apart on me when I was midway framing a shed. I’ve called my local hardware stores to see if I could buy a trigger mechanism for the new max nobody seems to have it tried eBay Amazon and no luck. I would stay clear of this gun.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Howe

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you have a large compressor, not for pancake.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and easy to use, but as always dependent on the air compressor. Cannot use the “pancake” compressor, just not enough volume. I use a stand up “garage” type compressor or a “wheel barrow” compressor and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good nailer but very poor packaging.
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is worth the price. It’s powerful and trouble free. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is due to the packaging. It arrived in the original thin cardboard box without a heavier outside shipping box. There was no blocking in the box so the nailer moved freely in it and broke holes in the box. Thankfully, other than a little bit of paint getting scraped off, the nailer does not appear damaged. I’ve included a photo of the box upon arrival.
customer_reviews.author: It is Me

customer_reviews.title: Not as lightweight as you would think
customer_reviews.text: It is actually quite heavy and a bit difficult to handle with one hand. The tip is squiggly and sometimes hangs up. For occasional use this is a good unit but for frequent use on larger jobs I would look for something else. In one of my other homes I have a Makita unit and it is a lot better in all aspects. But of course it is 3 times the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anderse

customer_reviews.title: Great first impression!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this nailer a couple of days and only shot about 100 nails with it, but I am impressed. Compared to my previous 2 nail guns, this one is lighter, seems to be built better, does not jam, and drives nails very consistently. Of course I don't know how well it will hold up over time, but as of right now I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Osborne

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like about it is
customer_reviews.text: I've had it about a year now and it works perfectly. I haven't had an issue or a miss fire. The only thing I don't like about it is, it takes full headed nails and I wish I had done a bit more homework before I bought it, because I would have gone with a split headed nail. The nail strips do not contain as many nails as a split headed nail strip, so you have to reload more frequently. If you're working on small projects it's ok, but if you're going to build a house or work on a project that requires a lot of nailing, go with a split headed nail gun.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but no packing in box
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great. Used it for doing some new framing construction in my basement. The only issue or concern I had was if this was or is a re-manufactured item b/x as I pick up the box the gun was rattling around in the box and when it was opened there was no plastic wrap, no Styrofoam, packing or anything. It was just the nail gun and another type of trigger in the box & manual, that was it. So again, I was a little concerned about that. But it looked brand new and again it worked very well....so overall I was happy w/ the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Hinners

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: My Dewalt broke and decided to get this to frame up a new bedroom in basement and no complaints! Worked flawlessly. The nail gun stops working when there is only a few nails left\loaded but just add another strip of nails and back in business. Well worth the price especially for the DIY at home projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Bushey

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value!
customer_reviews.text: Put together a fence with this over 2 days using both framing nails and 2" galvanized ring nails and NOT ONE JAM in over 1000 nails! It's a little heavy but no more so than a Paslode I've used. Easy to load AND unload when you want to switch nail size. OVERALL: THIS nailgun is a WINNER and NOT just based on price!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How does it invert nails?
customer_reviews.text: First pneumatic tool ever. Purchased for a shed build, and thank goodness it survived the critical parts of the build, but today... while installing shelves using 2” nails, the gun jammed and the nail inverted! I tried all manner of ways to remove it! Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain for small or one man jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised. Sometimes it won't fire the last few nails until you add another strip behind them. Only sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice product and it worked well right out of the box. The box was flimsy and was torn pretty badly in shipping but the product shows no sign of damage. Haven't used much yet, but I hope it will continue to work well. It is heavier than expected especially for an old man like me, but it is manageable. Over all it's a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought the nailer to put up a fence. The nailer worked great for the project. It did start hemorrhaging air towards the end. I contacted NuMax (Prime Global Products) for support and they gave me the options, which included replacement for my situation. Not wanting to take it apart myself, and unsure of the abilities and wait on repairs locally, I took them up on replacing it. It arrived within a few days and we were able to finish the project. I would definitely buy from them again since I've seen worse problems with finishing nailers with worse solutions from other companies. The nailer will be used again, and is a handy tool for large projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Liss

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Nailer for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Building a 12 X 16 garage. I used this nailer for the framing and putting up the OSB. Worked amazingly for the price. It's reliable and safe. Would buy again! 10/11/17 UPDATE: This nailer has blown away my expectations! I just finished my shed and have completed a few other projects using this gun. I put this against a $250 nailer and it competed equally with it. I would DEFINITELY recommend buying this for any of your framing nailing needs. Save the money and don't second guess it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I was a little confused at first because it suddenly stopped working and actually requested a replacement. However, I quickly realized that issue was a built-in feature. (it stop working when they is only about 5 nails remaining in the chamber.) My older nail will continue working, leaving holes in the material. By the time the replacement came, it had been working so great, I decided to keep both. One of the features I love best is been able to adjust the depth of nail penetration and the fact that it uses a variety of nail length. I think it a great product...
customer_reviews.author: Neil T.

customer_reviews.title: It Saved My Arm, My Wrist And My Hand! And...It Saved Me A Lot Of Time!
customer_reviews.text: A very useful tool but, I found it to be somewhat under-powered. Even though I adjusted the compressor pressure gauge higher than recommended and adjusted the setting on the tool for maximum impact, I still had to drive a lot of nails all the way in into the 2X4s with a hammer. Still...it saved me a lot of time!
customer_reviews.author: armor

customer_reviews.title: 3 large projects and not one problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nailer a year and a half ago and so far it has built a 20'x20' chicken coop a very large dog house (8'x16') and has put an interior in my in-laws 30x40 shop and has not missed a beat not ever. I would highly recommend this product to any DIYer looking for a budget nailer to get the job done without spending a few hundred dollars on a fancy one. I would say I would buy again but given its track record I doubt this will be needing replaced anytime soon. But when the time comes you bet I will.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for money
customer_reviews.text: It is a good nail gun if you need it just for a project. Complaint- it is not consistent with the depth of nail ever when the pressure is at 90. Very sensitive to the wood structure. Used it tp rebuild the deck with 2x6 fir, some of the nails were well below the surface, some i had to finish up with the hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor Novikov

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this nail gun for over a year now and have used it to build several privacy fences and a few decks. Overall its an exceptional tool for the money. Yes, the housing is plastic but I dont toss my tools around so it has held up well. Ive fed a number of boxes of 2" stainless ring shanks and 3" ring shanks with no issues at all. For a home owner or small contractor this is a great nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like the Big Brands
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people are reviewing that this tool is Large, but have they gone and looked at demos in the stores and compared them? They're about the same size and weight unless it's a specialized compact or battery powered model. This is the size a framing gun is. It works the same as a Milwaukee! At more than half the price. Put the oil that is included in the air inlet every 2 or 3rd time of use. This keeps it rust-free and well lubed. This is with any "air tool".
customer_reviews.author: Wild Wabbit

customer_reviews.title: Contractor quality for DIY price
customer_reviews.text: My new Hitachi nailer was stolen off my porch. Why buy another when I was almost done? I remembered my NuMax floor nailer worked perfect. I’ll try them again. Wow. This nailer will drive a 3.5 inch screw shank out of sight. No jams and a heavy duty metal nail rail. Get one now and enjoy. I put several thousand of the toughest nails to drive without a single hitch and less than half the price of Hitachi.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Worst packaging I have ever seen (not seen)
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today and the box looked beat up on the outside. When I opened the box I was surprised to see that there was absolutely NO PROTECTIVE PACKAGING whatsoever. It was just the nailer sitting in the box with the manual. The inside of the box was torn up from the nailer sliding around due to the absence of any styrafoam or anything to protect it. Needless to say the gun didn't work. C'mon, man!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Awesome nail gun
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with this product. I have used this nail gun on a couple of home projects and not commercially. Beginner level here. Pretty easy to use and maintain. It jams one time about every time i use it but the jams are pretty easy to clear. The one thing i would improve is the head of the nail gun to make it easier for the user to know precisely the point the nail will hit the wood for better toe-nailing because currently where the large circular head touches the wood it makes you guess. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: master chief

customer_reviews.title: Updated review works well, worth miney
customer_reviews.text: I had some issues getting this working and had a buddy correct it, something got out of place in transit but is working. I'm giving it 3 stars as the sensitivity is touch and go and at times hard to get that sweet spot. Also when using the recommended nails, it forms produce sparks so be mindful of your surrounds especially if inside near sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: JonBr84

customer_reviews.title: Beats renting!
customer_reviews.text: For what it costs to rent this tool, I took a chance and bought this one. I drove well over 1000 nails and it only misfired once. Not bad at all. It gets a little heavy/bulky after a while but it's still better than pounding nails or driving screws. A 3 gal. air compressor could not keep up with it if your "rapid firing" I reccomend 5 gal or more. I cheated and used my 60 gal shop compressor and it worked flawlessly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kidd

customer_reviews.title: More than Enough
customer_reviews.text: Building a shed I debated getting a nail gun to handle the hundreds of nails. Between the walls, frame, floors, and everything but the shingles this thing is great. Fast, powerful, and other than the weight, it beats the hell out of pounding hundreds of nails by hand. Bought the Square Trade and some oil, but after 1500 nails and no issues doubt I will need it. Would recommend to anyone working on home projects not afraid to DIY.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I got this to do a fencing project, that unfortunately is yet to be started... But I did build a garden bed, a gate, tool bench and fixed stuff with it. I never really knew I’d use it so much. I have never used an expensive one, but this one seems to do great for projects!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install a workshop in a previously-unfinished garage. I had to double the number of ceiling joists and and improve both the lower and upper structure of the garage. The nailer worked flawlessly. I did not not replace the roof so I can't rate it for very-high-nailing-rate use but for my job it worked great. My only squawk is that the company's on-line documentation is outdated. The instructions that ship with the product are correct and up-to-date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works fine, good value
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problems with it, no jams, so haven't really minded the lack of auto-clearing feature. It accidentally bump-fired once despite being on single shot mode, but I think that's just poor technique on my part. It's a bit heavy. No big deal at first, but the weight gets to you after a few hours of continuous use. Still, much cheaper than the ones at my local DIY store.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Esperantist

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer, well constructed and easy action
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This just made my job a lot easier. Easy to use right out of the box just add the nails. Did a great job. Easy depth adjustment. Make sure you have a good amount of nails in the unit. If you get down to a few nails left it will not be enough tension to push the nail into the chamber. Just add another set of nails and you are good to go. Also, it was a steal for $66.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This nail gun is a BEAST!!!
customer_reviews.text: This nail gun has to be one of my best purchases this year. It has cut my construct time down to a quarter of the time it would normally take me. Easy to use, east to maintain, so safe my wife uses it. I wish that I had purchased this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Of Brian Photography

customer_reviews.title: NOT toolless adjustment but for a DIY guy good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Its decent - not great, i recommend it for a DIY guy but not a pro contractor. gun does not completely tooless in its adjustments, requires two hands just to release the nail cartridge slide. not overly heavy or noisy, nice feature is adjustable exhaust port All in all should last a long time if you put a few drops of gun oil in the inlet before use WAY cheaper than my dewalt which only lasted a few thousand nails before it died
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod Beeblebrox

customer_reviews.title: it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I did not have much expectation from it. Given that it is cheap enough. But it exceeded my expectations. saved me from lot of frustations when my contractor left without finishing work. I was able to finish all work and no issues so far. Just make sure pressure is good and replace nails before down to 5. Last 5 nails do not work.
customer_reviews.author: Ajit Singh

customer_reviews.title: Great lower cost nailer for home DIYers
customer_reviews.text: I have several higher end finish nailers but needed a framing gun for a man cave project. I framed an 18x24 room and ceiling without any issues. I can think of maybe twice where the gun "misfired". Easy to adjust the depth. It is a little bulky and heavy, so getting into narrow spaces is a challenge. I cant speak to the long term durability of this gun, but for this project it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is heavy for me, but my husband has no issues with it (I am just weak haha). We used it to build our fence and it was great! It worked very well, went along flawlessly with the air compressor we had. We have used this multiple times for home projects. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin & Heather

customer_reviews.title: It does not jam!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first framing nailers I’ve purchased. I looked at ones that were much more expensive, but this one was much cheaper than the named brand ones. For $6 I bought. 3 years warranty and still under $90. The only negative (which is minor) is its a little heavy....after several hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: qwk93ta

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a set of NuMax finish nail guns from Costco a couple of years ago. They have performed well. When I saw this on Amazon for the price I couldn't pass it up. Been very pleased with it. Most work so far has been overhead and this nail gun is heavy. But this is more than worth the price since I would pay as much to rent one and now I own one.
customer_reviews.author: DAC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needed a nailer to frame out under our home. Needed a reasonably priced unit as I most likely will not use it much after this if ever again. Didn't have any jams of misfires during the project. Got an amazing amount of quality for my money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Roth

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this tool. Rebuilt backyard wood fence. Ran about 2000 nails thru it. NO issues at all, worked every time I pulled the trigger!! Safety features & adjustments worked. For my project & the price, I would give it ten stars! Don't know how long it will operate flawlessly? It's earned my thumbs up rating!
customer_reviews.author: Mitch R.

customer_reviews.title: Kicks like a mule.
customer_reviews.text: I had to dial it down because I was only using 2 1/2" nails but it drove those easily so it should handle bigger nails no problem. It's heavy so don't think it a lightweight toy. I don't know if it'll last years and years but you should easily get your moneys worth out of it.
customer_reviews.author: RickeyM

customer_reviews.title: Garage Remodel works well
customer_reviews.text: Using along with Home Depot Porter 150psi compressor & they work well together without to much compressor recycle (can do an 8' wall/16"oc studs & plates prior to recycle). Wanted something that would save my body from the standard hammer & nailing for a limited amount of home use so this does a good job meeting those needs.
customer_reviews.author: xb1

customer_reviews.title: Big, beefy nailer at an economy price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you really cannot beat this tool. I bought one in order to do a fence in my backyard. It is a big, beefy nailer, as you would expect from a nail gun. No jams and no issues throughout the job. Loads easily. Nailed pretty consistently (I would estimate a misfire about 1 out of every 250 nails--where the nail would go in sideways at the top part--probably caused by some knot I hit or another nail or moving the gun for all I know). Doesn't have a lot of bells and whistles, but I didn't need them either. Again, coming back to the price, very pleased with this value purchase!
customer_reviews.author: T. Donoughue

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. Still do. No jams, however 3 1/2” did not seat all the way. 3” and under, no problem. I am still getting used to it but my air compressor is a 5 gallon Cambesfield. That could have been the issue - however the settings were as suggested. Great product. Built like a tank. Added a paracord hook, and it aggravates me that it stops at 4 nails left, but it never jammed either.
customer_reviews.author: Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: It worked real good for a while and then slowly it was harder to get the nose piece to engage properly, you had to wiggle it to engage, but I kept at it. Next to go wrong was the snap ring that holds the nose piece. I reinstalled it but evidently it had run its course and was stretched (it must have had poor tempering). It is not a bad gun if it had work properly like when I bought it..........but it did not keep up
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: No problem. Just pay attention to the translation of the warning label. The safety note in english says : "The gun will not fire if there are less then 7 nails " The french note translate to : "The gun will stop cooking if there are less than 7 nails" ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Benoit ROUVERY

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: This air nailer in my opinion is the best nailer for the price. I would buy again and recommend. 3" ring shank into 2x10 header no problem. I seen some reviews about the weight, I don't think it's any heavier the the top name brands.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C.

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use nailer, bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I received this nailer about a week ago and put about 1200 nails through it this weekend. Though not the biggest workout, this nailer worked great! It was spot on, safe, trigger responsive, and adjusted well to the PSI changes. I ran it off of a 20 gallon compressor, which allowed for smooth operation, no glitches, and ease of use. For the money and the home do it yourself-er, so far, this was a great purchase and well worth the money. It wasn't to heavy, though it was bigger than I imagined. This is my first nail gun, so I don't have any comparisons.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Shiloh

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than expected, excellent quality, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a lighter version of an old Harbor Freight fun that lasted me for years. Works well, ready to reload, doesn't jamb, but because it's lighter, it has a tendency to bounce a bit, leaving the nail head up. Not always, but enough to notice. Still, for the money, you cannot beat this gun. Already shot 1000 nails building a deck, and it worked flawlessly. Very pleased, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderlizard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Residing home. Once a sheet of t1-11 up couple of minuets its nailed. This making job a LOT easier. Plus not banging on the studs with hammer, popping the drywall screws inside. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for a shed I was building. I was hesitant to buy it because I hadn't heard of the brand before but the price was right. So far, I've run about a 1,000 nails through it and it hasn't had a misfire or gotten jammed. For a weekend diy'er, this is well worth the money. It comes with a trigger to use for bump firing but I haven't used it. That seems too dangerous and is best left to professionals. For safety, definitely wear eye protection. The plastic strips holding the nails sometimes fly back at your face. It's also loud, so I wear foam ear plugs while using it.
customer_reviews.author: Tango Lima

product_meta.title: NuMax SFR2190 Pneumatic 21 Degree 3-1/2" Full Round Head Framing Nailer Ergonomic and Lightweight Nail Gun with Tool-Free Depth Adjust and No Mar Tip
product_meta.description: Size:21° Full Head Framing Nailer| Style:Nail GunSfr2190 features: -Framing nailer. -360° adjustable exhaust. -Finger depth adjustment. -Ergonomically designed comfort grip. Type of nailer: -Framing nailers. Type of fastener: -Framing nails. Generic dimensions: -20.75'' h x 15'' w x 5.75'' d. Dimensions: Overall height - top to bottom: -20.75 inches. Overall width - side to side: -15 inches. Overall product weight: -8.5 pounds.
feature_bullets: Nailed It: This 21 degree pneumatic framing nailer features a lightweight and durable magnesium body, ergonomic secure handle, and interchangeable trigger for quick fire or single shot function. It's ideal for professional construction contractors and home DIY projects.

Versatile and Powerful: The framing nailer features depth adjustment and a no mar tip, making it adaptable for different working surfaces. It's perfect for framing, and it can also be used to install subfloors, roof decking, wood fencing, and sheathing.Minimum Recommended Air Delivery SCFM @ 90PSI:2.4

The Right Tool for the Job: We're committed to providing outstanding value, top tier customer service and long lasting, high quality products. We make nailers and staplers for every purpose, from roofing to siding to flooring and everything in between.

Quality and Durability: We manufacture tools with the most durable materials under strict quality control guidelines, suitable for professional contractors and do-it-yourselfers alike. Our tools are sold, distributed, serviced, and warrantied in the USA.

Tough and Dependable: We make an array of durable construction tools and accessories, including staplers and nailers for siding, flooring, framing, finish, and roofing. Compare our products to similar items by Makita, Hitachi, Bostitch, Senco, Paslode, and Dewalt.

specifications.Included Components: Pneumatic 21 Degree 3-1/2" Full Round Head Framing Nailer; Air Tool Oil; Adjustment Tools
specifications.Warranty Description: 1 Year Limited Warranty and 30 Day Wearable Parts Warranty
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,115 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
